preibisch_imagej.axis

Interface CalibratedAxis

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Axis, TypedAxis
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    LinearAxis
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCalibratedAxis, ChapmanRichardsAxis, DefaultLinearAxis, ExponentialAxis, ExponentialRecoveryAxis, GammaVariateAxis, GaussianAxis, IdentityAxis, InverseRodbardAxis, LogLinearAxis, PolynomialAxis, PowerAxis, RodbardAxis, Variable1Axis, Variable2Axis, Variable3Axis, Variable4Axis, VariableAxis

    public interface CalibratedAxis
extends TypedAxis
    An axis with an associated AxisType, unit and calibration.
    Author:
    Curtis Rueden, Barry DeZonia
    See Also:
    TypedAxis

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double averageScale(double rawValue1, double rawValue2)
      Returns the average scale between two raw value coordinates along an axis.
      double calibratedValue(double rawValue)
      Returns a calibrated value given a raw position along the axis.
      CalibratedAxis copy()
      Creates an exact duplicate of this axis.
      String generalEquation()
      Gets the general equation representing values along this axis; for instance: y = m*x + b.
      String particularEquation()
      Gets the particular equation representing values along this axis; for instance: y = (14)*x + (4).

      Returns a raw value given a calibrated position along the axis.
      void setUnit(String unit)
      Sets the dimension's unit.

      • Methods inherited from interface preibisch_imagej.axis.TypedAxis

        setType, type

    • Method Detail

      • unit

        String unit()
        Gets the dimension's unit.

      • setUnit

        void setUnit(String unit)
        Sets the dimension's unit.

      • calibratedValue

        double calibratedValue(double rawValue)
        Returns a calibrated value given a raw position along the axis.

      • rawValue

        double rawValue(double calibratedValue)
        Returns a raw value given a calibrated position along the axis. Returns Double.NaN if the calibrated value maps to more than one point along axis.

      • generalEquation

        String generalEquation()
        Gets the general equation representing values along this axis; for instance: y = m*x + b.

      • particularEquation

        String particularEquation()
        Gets the particular equation representing values along this axis; for instance: y = (14)*x + (4).

      • averageScale

        double averageScale(double rawValue1,
                    double rawValue2)
        Returns the average scale between two raw value coordinates along an axis.

        In the limit this is actually the derivative at a point. For linear axes this value never varies, and there is no error. For nonlinear axes this returns the linear scale between the points and thus may be inaccurate. Calls to this method may point out areas of code that should be generalized to work with nonlinear axes.

      • copy

        CalibratedAxis copy()
        Creates an exact duplicate of this axis.
